duties_responsibilities.duty: Oversee the end-to-end payroll process, ensuring timely and accurate compensation while adhering to regulatory requirements and company policies.
Stay up-to-date with federal, state, and local regulations pertaining to payroll, taxes, and benefits.
Maintain a rigorous focus on financial accuracy and controls within the payroll function, implementing checks and balances to minimize errors and discrepancies.
Lead and develop a team of payroll professionals, providing guidance, coaching, and mentorship.
Oversee the selection, implementation, and maintenance of payroll software systems, collaborating with IT and finance teams to enhance system efficiency, data accuracy, and security.

Collaborate with internal departments to ensure seamless integration of payroll processes with broader organizational goals, including compensation planning, benefit administration, and financial reporting.
Generate accurate and comprehensive payroll reports for leadership and external auditors, providing insights into payroll expenses, trends, and analysis.
Develop and implement contingency plans to ensure payroll continuity during emergencies or system disruptions, and continuously evaluate payroll processes for efficiency gains and automation.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field (Advanced degree and relevant certifications preferred)
